net.toddm.cache

Class CacheEntry

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.toddm.cache.CacheEntry

  • public class CacheEntry
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents an entry in a cache. Cache entries have unique keys, values, TTLs, and creation and modification timestamps. They optionally also have an ETag value and source URI.
    Author:
    Todd S. Murchison

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CacheEntry(java.lang.String key, byte[] value, long ttl, java.lang.String eTag, java.net.URI sourceUri)
      Creates an instance of CacheEntry from the given values.
      CacheEntry(java.lang.String key, java.lang.String valueString, byte[] valueBytes, long ttl, java.lang.String eTag, java.net.URI sourceUri, long timestampCreated, long timestampModified)
      This version of the constructor is for use by CacheProvider implementers that need to deserialize instances of CacheEntry and therefore need access to setting all fields.
      CacheEntry(java.lang.String key, java.lang.String value, long ttl, java.lang.String eTag, java.net.URI sourceUri)
      Creates an instance of CacheEntry from the given values.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte[] getBytesValue()
      Returns the bytes value for this cache entry.
      java.lang.String getEtag()
      Returns the ETag for this cache entry if it has one.
      java.lang.String getKey()
      Returns the unique key for this cache entry.
      java.lang.String getStringValue()
      Returns the String value for this cache entry.
      java.lang.Long getTimestampCreated()
      Returns an epoch representation of the creation timestamp for this cache entry.
      java.lang.Long getTimestampModified()
      Returns an epoch representation of the most recent time that this cache entry was updated.
      java.lang.Long getTtl()
      Returns the Time To Live (TTL) for this cache entry.
      java.net.URI getUri()
      Returns the source URI for this cache entry if it has one.
      boolean hasExpired()
      If this CacheEntry instance has expired, based on it's TTL value and creation time, this method will return true, otherwise false is returned.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • CacheEntry

        public CacheEntry(java.lang.String key,
          java.lang.String value,
          long ttl,
          java.lang.String eTag,
          java.net.URI sourceUri)
        Creates an instance of CacheEntry from the given values. Creation and modification timestamps are set to the current system time.

        Parameters:
        key - A unique key value for this cache entry.
        value - The value of this cache entry (can be NULL).
        ttl - The Time To Live (TTL) of this cache entry. Any value less than 1 will result in an entry that is always stale.
        eTag - An optional entity tag value. This can be NULL if your cache does not make use of ETags.
        sourceUri - An optional source URI. This can be NULL if you do not make use of URIs.

      • CacheEntry

        public CacheEntry(java.lang.String key,
          byte[] value,
          long ttl,
          java.lang.String eTag,
          java.net.URI sourceUri)
        Creates an instance of CacheEntry from the given values. Creation and modification timestamps are set to the current system time.

        Parameters:
        key - A unique key value for this cache entry.
        value - The value of this cache entry (can be NULL).
        ttl - The Time To Live (TTL) of this cache entry. Any value less than 1 will result in an entry that is always stale.
        eTag - An optional entity tag value. This can be NULL if your cache does not make use of ETags.
        sourceUri - An optional source URI. This can be NULL if you do not make use of URIs.

      • CacheEntry

        public CacheEntry(java.lang.String key,
          java.lang.String valueString,
          byte[] valueBytes,
          long ttl,
          java.lang.String eTag,
          java.net.URI sourceUri,
          long timestampCreated,
          long timestampModified)
        This version of the constructor is for use by CacheProvider implementers that need to deserialize instances of CacheEntry and therefore need access to setting all fields.

        Parameters:
        key - A unique key value for this cache entry.
        valueString - The string value of this cache entry (can be NULL).
        valueBytes - The bytes value of this cache entry (can be NULL).
        ttl - The Time To Live (TTL) of this cache entry. Any value less than 1 will result in an entry that is always stale.
        eTag - An optional entity tag value. This can be NULL if your cache does not make use of ETags.
        sourceUri - An optional source URI. This can be NULL if you do not make use of URIs.
        timestampCreated - The epoch representation of the creation timestamp for this cache entry.
        timestampModified - The epoch representation of the creation timestamp for this cache entry.

    • Method Detail

      • getKey

        public java.lang.String getKey()
        Returns the unique key for this cache entry.

      • getStringValue

        public java.lang.String getStringValue()
        Returns the String value for this cache entry. May return null.

      • getBytesValue

        public byte[] getBytesValue()
        Returns the bytes value for this cache entry. May return null.

      • getTtl

        public java.lang.Long getTtl()
        Returns the Time To Live (TTL) for this cache entry.

      • getEtag

        public java.lang.String getEtag()
        Returns the ETag for this cache entry if it has one.

      • getUri

        public java.net.URI getUri()
        Returns the source URI for this cache entry if it has one.

      • getTimestampCreated

        public java.lang.Long getTimestampCreated()
        Returns an epoch representation of the creation timestamp for this cache entry.

      • getTimestampModified

        public java.lang.Long getTimestampModified()
        Returns an epoch representation of the most recent time that this cache entry was updated.

      • hasExpired

        public boolean hasExpired()
        If this CacheEntry instance has expired, based on it's TTL value and creation time, this method will return true, otherwise false is returned.
